TI: Fractional Laplacian equations with critical Sobolev exponent
DE: Mountain Pass Theorem; Linking Theorem; Critical nonlinearities; Best fractional critical Sobolev constant; Palais-Smale condition; Variational techniques; Integrodifferential operators; Fractional Laplacian
AB: In this paper we complete the study of the following elliptic equation driven by a general non-local integrodifferential operator L-K {L(K)u + lambda u + |u|(2)*(-2)u + f(x, u) = 0 in Omega u = 0 in R-n\Omega, that was started by Servadei and Valdinoci (Commun Pure Appl Anal 12( 6): 24452464, 2013). Here s is an element of(0,1), Omega is an open bounded set of R-n, n > 2s, with continuous boundary, lambda is a positive real parameter, 2* = 2n / (n - 2s) is a fractional critical Sobolev exponent and f is a lower order perturbation of the critical power |u|(2)*(-2)u, while L-K is the integrodifferential operator defined as L(K)u(x) = integral(n)(R)(u(x + y) + u(x - y) - 2u(x)) K(y) dy, x is an element of R-n. Under suitable growth condition on f, we show that this problem admits non-trivial solutions for any positive parameter lambda. This existence theorem extends some results obtained in [15,19,20]. In the model case, that is when K(x) = |x|(-(n+2s)) (this gives rise to the fractional Laplace operator -(-Delta)(S)), the existence result proved along the paper may be read as the non-local fractional counterpart of the one obtained in [12] (see also [9]) in the framework of the classical Laplace equation with critical nonlinearities.
C1: [Servadei, Raffaella] Univ Urbino Carlo Bo, Dipartimento Sci Base & Fondamenti, I-61029 Urbino, Pesaro E Urbino, Italy; [Valdinoci, Enrico] Univ Milan, Dipartimento Matemat, I-20133 Milan, Italy; [Valdinoci, Enrico] Weierstr Inst Angew Anal & Stochast, D-10117 Berlin, Germany
RP: Valdinoci, E (reprint author), Univ Milan, Dipartimento Matemat, Via Cesare Saldini 50, I-20133 Milan, Italy.

FX: R. Servadei was supported by the MIUR National Research Project Variational and Topological Methods in the Study of Nonlinear Phenomena and by the INDAM-GNAMPA Project Variational Methods for the Study of Nonlocal Elliptic Equations with Fractional Laplacian Operators, while E. Valdinoci was supported by the MIUR National Research Project Nonlinear Elliptic Problems in the Study of Vortices and Related Topics and the FIRB project A&B (Analysis and Beyond). Both the authors were supported by the ERC grant is an element of(Elliptic Pde's and Symmetry of Interfaces and Layers for Odd Nonlinearities).

TI: Morrey spaces, their duals and preduals
DE: Morrey spaces; Dual Morrey spaces; Besov spaces; Embeddings; Calderon-Zygmund operators
AB: This survey deals with Morrey spaces, their duals and preduals in the framework of tempered distributions on Euclidean spaces. We concentrate on basic assertions (including density and non-separability), duality, embeddings (including relations to distinguished Besov spaces) and applications to Caldern-Zygmund operators.
C1: [Rosenthal, Marcel; Triebel, Hans] Univ Jena, Math Inst, Fak Math & Informat, D-07737 Jena, Germany
RP: Triebel, H (reprint author), Univ Jena, Math Inst, Fak Math & Informat, D-07737 Jena, Germany.

TI: An introduction to functional data analysis and a principal component approach for testing the equality of mean curvesf
DE: Functional data; m-approximability; Weak convergence; FANOVA; Projections
ID: WEAK INVARIANCE-PRINCIPLES; VALUED RANDOM-VARIABLES; ANOVA; BOOTSTRAP; INDEPENDENCE; STABILITY; MATRIX; SUMS
AB: We give an introduction to functional data analysis, with examples, and provide a brief review of the literature. We explain how principal component analysis (PCA) can be used to transform curves into finite dimensional data. An application of PCA is developed to test for the equality of the means of several populations (functional analysis of variance). Asymptotics are derived under the null hypothesis that the populations have the same mean curves. The selection of the basis for the projections and the power of the test is discussed for simple random samples and stationary time series samples of curves. We review the part of the literature which is needed to establish the validity of the PCA method. Two data sets, magnetogram records and stock returns, are used to illustrate the applicability of our limit results.
C1: [Horvath, Lajos; Rice, Gregory] Univ Utah, Dept Math, Salt Lake City, UT 84112 USA
RP: Horvath, L (reprint author), Univ Utah, Dept Math, Salt Lake City, UT 84112 USA.

AU: Kriegl, A; Michor, PW; Rainer, A
AF: Kriegl, Andreas; Michor, Peter W.; Rainer, Armin
TI: The convenient setting for Denjoy-Carleman differentiable mappings of Beurling and Roumieu type
DE: Convenient setting; Denjoy-Carleman classes of Roumieu and Beurling type; Quasianalytic and non-quasianalytic mappings of moderate growth; Whitney jets on Banach spaces
AB: We prove in a uniform way that all Denjoy-Carleman differentiable function classes of Beurling type C-(M) and of Roumieu type C-{M}, admit a convenient setting if the weight sequence M = (M-k) is log-convex and of moderate growth: For C denoting either C-(M) or C-{M}, the category of C-mappings is cartesian closed in the sense that C(E, C(F, G))congruent to C(E x F, G) for convenient vector spaces. Applications to manifolds of mappings are given: The group of C-diffeomorphisms is a regular C-Lie group if C superset of C-omega, but not better.
C1: [Kriegl, Andreas; Michor, Peter W.; Rainer, Armin] Univ Vienna, Fak Math, A-1090 Vienna, Austria
RP: Michor, PW (reprint author), Univ Vienna, Fak Math, Oskar Morgenstern Pl 1, A-1090 Vienna, Austria.

AU: Dilworth, SJ; Kutzarova, D; Oikhberg, T
AF: Dilworth, S. J.; Kutzarova, D.; Oikhberg, T.
TI: Lebesgue constants for the weak greedy algorithm
DE: Weak greedy algorithm; Biorthogonal system; Markushevitch basis; Lebesgue constant
ID: BIORTHOGONAL SYSTEMS; BANACH-SPACES; BASES; APPROXIMATION; INEQUALITIES
AB: We estimate the Lebesgue constants for the weak thresholding greedy algorithm in a Banach space relative to a biorthogonal system. The estimates involve the weakness (relaxation) parameter of the algorithm, as well as properties of the basis, such as its quasi-greedy constant and democracy function.

AU: Izumi, T; Sawano, Y; Tanaka, H
AF: Izumi, Takashi; Sawano, Yoshihiro; Tanaka, Hitoshi
TI: Littlewood-Paley theory for Morrey spaces and their preduals
DE: Block spaces; Morrey spaces; Littlewood-Paley spaces; Fatou property
AB: Zorko proved that Morrey spaces are known to have preduals. In the present paper such predual spaces are shown to be characterized by means of the Littlewood-Paley operators. Recently, many function spaces are shown to admit the Littlewood-Paley characterization. As for the predual spaces of Morrey spaces, it had not been clear that a pointwise increasing norm-bounded sequence has a least bound. However, the author proved in the earlier paper that it actually has a least bound. In the present paper, by taking advantage of this property, a characterization by means of Littlewood-Paley operators is proposed.
C1: [Izumi, Takashi] Yamagata Univ, Dept Math Sci, Yamagata 9908560, Japan; [Sawano, Yoshihiro] Tokyo Metropolitan Univ, Dept Math & Informat Sci, Hachioji, Tokyo 1920397, Japan; [Tanaka, Hitoshi] Univ Tokyo, Grad Sch Math Sci, Tokyo 1538914, Japan

Tanaka was supported by the FMSP program at Graduate School of Mathematical Sciences, the University of Tokyo, and Grant-in-Aid for Scientific Research (C) (No. 23540187), the Japan Society for the Promotion of Science. The authors are grateful to the anonymous referee for his kind suggestion, which made us aware of the difference between two different Littlewood-Paley characterizations.

TI: Universal Taylor series and summability
DE: Universal Taylor series; Ostrowski-gaps; Matrix summability method
AB: We introduce classes of universal Taylor series, both topologically and algebraically generic, whose image under some regular matrix summability methods are automatically universal.
C1: [Charpentier, S.] Aix Marseille Univ, UMR 7353, Lab Anal Topol & Probabil, F-13453 Marseille 13, France; [Mouze, A.] Lab Paul Painleve, UMR 8524, F-59650 Villeneuve Dascq, France

TI: A priori bounds for positive solutions of subcritical elliptic equations
DE: A priori estimates; Positive solutions; Subcritical nonlinearity; Moving planes method; Kelvin transform
AB: We provide a-priori bounds for positive solutions to a class of subcritical elliptic problems in bounded domains. Our analysis widens the known ranges of subcritical nonlinearities for which positive solutions are a-priori bounded.
C1: [Castro, Alfonso] Harvey Mudd Coll, Dept Math, Claremont, CA 91711 USA; [Pardo, Rosa] Univ Complutense Madrid, Dept Matemat Aplicada, E-28040 Madrid, Spain

AU: Gomez, TL; Sols, I; Zamora, A
AF: Gomez, Tomas L.; Sols, Ignacio; Zamora, Alfonso
TI: A GIT interpretation of the Harder-Narasimhan filtration
DE: Vector bundles; Moduli space; Stability; Geometric invariant theory
AB: An unstable torsion free sheaf on a smooth projective variety gives a GIT unstable point in certain Quot scheme. To a GIT unstable point, Kempf associates a "maximally destabilizing" 1-parameter subgroup, and this induces a filtration of the torsion free sheaf. We show that this filtration coincides with the Harder-Narasimhan filtration.

Zamora would like to thank the Department of Mathematics at Columbia University, where part of this work was done, for hospitality. This work is part of A. Zamora's Ph.D. thesis (c.f. [16]).

TI: An optimal transportation problem related to the limits of solutions of local and nonlocal -Laplace-type problems
DE: Optimal transportation; Nonlocal equation; p-Laplace equation
AB: We investigate the asymptotic behavior of minimizers of problems related to the -Laplace equation . As , the minimizers converge (up to a subsequence) to a function, which maximizes the functional with appropriate constraints. The main result of this paper is that the problem of maximizing with Dirichlet boundary condition can be identified as a dual problem of a certain mass transportation problem. Our approach applies to the limits of both -Laplace type problems in classical Sobolev spaces and analogous nonlocal problems in fractional Sobolev spaces.
C1: Univ Jyvaskyla, Dept Math & Stat, FI-40014 Jyvaskyla, Finland
RP: Jylha, H (reprint author), Univ Jyvaskyla, Dept Math & Stat, POB 35 MaD, FI-40014 Jyvaskyla, Finland.
FX: The author would like to thank Petri Juutinen for introducing the author to the problems discussed in this paper and Julio Rossi for sharing his ideas about how to generalize the results. The author would also like to thank the reviewers for their helpful comments. The author has been supported by University of Jyvaskyla and Vaisala Foundation.

TI: Continuous selections of Lipschitz extensions in metric spaces
DE: Lipschitz mapping; Extension operator; Continuous selection; Geodesic space of bounded curvature; Hyperconvexity
AB: This paper deals with the study of parameter dependence of extensions of Lipschitz mappings from the point of view of continuity. We show that if assuming appropriate curvature bounds for the spaces, the multivalued extension operators that assign to every bounded nonexpansive (resp. bounded Lipschitz) mapping all its bounded nonexpansive extensions (resp. bounded Lipschitz extensions with the same Lipschitz constant) are lower semi-continuous and admit continuous selections. Moreover, we prove that Lipschitz mappings can be extended continuously even when imposing the condition that the image of the extension belongs to the closure of the convex hull of the image of the original mapping. When the target space is hyperconvex one can obtain in fact nonexpansivity.
C1: [Espinola, Rafa] Univ Seville, Fac Matemat, Dept Anal Matemat, E-41012 Seville, Spain; [Nicolae, Adriana] Univ Babes Bolyai, Dept Math, Cluj Napoca 400084, Romania; [Nicolae, Adriana] Acad Romana, Res Grp Project PD 3 0152, Simion Stoilow Inst Math, RO-014700 Bucharest, Romania
RP: Espinola, R (reprint author), Univ Seville, Fac Matemat, Dept Anal Matemat, E-41012 Seville, Spain.

TI: Heat and Navier-Stokes equations in supercritical function spaces
DE: Heat equations; Navier-Stokes equations; Function spaces; Strong solutions
AB: The paper deals with solutions of nonlinear heat and Navier-Stokes equations in the context of Besov and Triebel-Lizorkin spaces and where 1 <= p, q <= infinity and -1 + n/p < s < n/p.
C1: Univ Jena, Dept Math, D-07737 Jena, Germany
RP: Baaske, F (reprint author), Univ Jena, Dept Math, D-07737 Jena, Germany.

AU: Campillo, A; Delgado, F; Gusein-Zade, SM
AF: Campillo, A.; Delgado, F.; Gusein-Zade, S. M.
TI: An equivariant Poincar, series of filtrations and monodromy zeta functions
DE: Finite group actions; Filtrations; Poincare series; Monodromy zeta functions; Plane valuations
AB: We define a new equivariant (with respect to a finite group action) version of the Poincar, series of a multi-index filtration as an element of the power series ring for a certain modification of the Burnside ring of the group . We give a formula for this Poincar, series of a collection of plane valuations in terms of a -resolution of the collection. We show that, for filtrations on the ring of germs of functions in two variables defined by the curve valuations corresponding to the irreducible components of a plane curve singularity defined by a -invariant function germ, in the majority of cases this equivariant Poincar, series determines the corresponding equivariant monodromy zeta functions defined earlier.
C1: [Campillo, A.; Delgado, F.] Univ Valladolid, IMUVA Inst Invest Matemat, E-47011 Valladolid, Spain; [Gusein-Zade, S. M.] Moscow MV Lomonosov State Univ, Fac Math & Mech, Moscow 119991, Russia

AF: Garcia Barroso, Evelia Rosa; Ploski, Arkadiusz
TI: An approach to plane algebroid branches
DE: Plane algebroid curve; Branch; Semigroup associated with a branch; Key polynomials; Logarithmic distance; Abhyankar-Moh theory
ID: GENERALIZED TSCHIRNHAUSEN TRANSFORMATION; HAMBURGER-NOETHER EXPANSIONS; NEWTON-PUISEUX EXPANSION; IRREDUCIBILITY; SEMIGROUPS; VALUATIONS; CRITERIA; CURVES; RINGS
AB: We consider a new approach to the local geometry of plane algebraic curves that allows us to obtain the basic results of the theory of plane algebroid branches over algebraically closed fields of arbitrary characteristic. We do not use the Hamburger-Noether expansions. Our basic tool is the logarithmic distance on the set of branches satisfying the strong triangle inequality which permits to make calculations directly on the equations of branches.
C1: [Garcia Barroso, Evelia Rosa] Univ La Laguna, Secc Matemat, Dept Matemat Estadist & Invest Operat, Tenerife 38271, Spain; [Ploski, Arkadiusz] Kielce Univ Technol, Dept Math, PL-25314 Kielce, Poland

AU: Costa, AF; Izquierdo, M; Parlier, H
AF: Costa, Antonio F.; Izquierdo, Milagros; Parlier, Hugo
TI: Connecting -gonal loci in the compactification of moduli space
DE: Hyperbolic surfaces; Isometries of surfaces; Branch locus of moduli space
ID: RIEMANN SURFACES; BRANCH LOCUS; CONNECTEDNESS; DIMENSION; CURVES; GENUS
AB: Consider the moduli space of Riemann surfaces of genus and its Deligne-Mumford compactification . We are interested in the branch locus for , i.e., the subset of consisting of surfaces with automorphisms. It is well-known that the set of hyperelliptic surfaces (the hyperelliptic locus) is connected in but the set of (cyclic) trigonal surfaces is not. By contrast, the set of (cyclic) trigonal surfaces is connected in . We exhibit an explicit nodal surface that lies in the completion of every equisymmetric set of -gonal Riemann surfaces providing an alternative proof of a result of Achter and Pries (Math Ann 338:187-206, 2007). For the connectivity of the -gonal loci becomes more involved. We show that for prime and genus there are one-dimensional strata of cyclic -gonal surfaces that are completely isolated in the completion of the branch locus in .
C1: [Costa, Antonio F.] UNED, Fac Ciencias, Dept Matemat Fundamentales, Madrid, Spain; [Izquierdo, Milagros] Linkoping Univ, Dept Math, S-58183 Linkoping, Sweden; [Parlier, Hugo] Univ Fribourg, Dept Math, CH-1700 Fribourg, Switzerland

TI: Influence of surface roughness to solutions of the Boussinesq equations with Robin boundary condition
DE: Instationary Boussinesq equations; Weak solutions; Robin boundary condition; Young measures
AB: Since the boundary of every physical domain is covered by microscopic asperities, we replace such a domain by an approximating sequence of domains having rough boundaries. We consider the instationary Boussinesq equations in these approximating domains where the temperature satisfies certain Robin boundary conditions. In the limit we will observe an additional weight factor in the Robin boundary condition which reflects the rugosity of the boundaries. Motivated by this observation we deal with the converse situation. Indeed, we will show that every Robin boundary condition with a fixed weight factor can be generated in the asymptotic limit by a sequence of domains with rough boundaries.
C1: Tech Univ Darmstadt, Dept Math, D-64289 Darmstadt, Germany
RP: Komo, C (reprint author), Tech Univ Darmstadt, Dept Math, D-64289 Darmstadt, Germany.

TI: The Aojasiewicz exponent over a field of arbitrary characteristic
DE: Generalized power series; Lojasiewicz exponent; Parametrization; Newton polygon method
AB: Let be an algebraically closed field and let denote the field of generalized series with coefficients in . We propose definitions of the local Aojasiewicz exponent of as well as of the Aojasiewicz exponent at infinity of , which generalize the familiar case of and (resp. ), see ChA...dzyA"ski and KrasiA"ski (In: Singularities, 1988; In: Singularities, 1988; Ann Polon Math 67(3):297-301, 1997; Ann Polon Math 67(2):191-197, 1997), and prove some basic properties of such numbers. Namely, we show that in both cases the exponent is attained on a parametrization of a component of (Theorems 6 and 7), thus being a rational number. To this end, we define the notion of the Aojasiewicz pseudoexponent of for which we give a description of all the generalized series that extract the pseudoexponent, in terms of their jets. In particular, we show that there exist only finitely many jets of generalized series giving the pseudoexponent of (Theorem 5). The main tool in the proofs is the algebraic version of Newton's Polygon Method. The results are illustrated with some explicit examples.
C1: [Brzostowski, Szymon; Rodak, Tomasz] Univ Lodz, Fac Math & Comp Sci, PL-90238 Lodz, Poland
RP: Rodak, T (reprint author), Univ Lodz, Fac Math & Comp Sci, Ul Banacha 22, PL-90238 Lodz, Poland.

TI: Integral isoperimetric transference and dimensionless Sobolev inequalities
DE: Sobolev inequalities; Symmetrization; Isoperimetric inequalities; Extrapolation
AB: We introduce the concept of Gaussian integral isoperimetric transfer and show how it can be applied to obtain a new class of sharp Sobolev-Poincar, inequalities with constants independent of the dimension. In the special case of spaces on the unit -dimensional cube our results extend the recent inequalities that were obtained in Fiorenza et al. (2012) using extrapolation.
C1: [Martin, Joaquim; Milman, Mario] Univ Autonoma Barcelona, Dept Math, E-08193 Barcelona, Spain
RP: Milman, M (reprint author), Univ Autonoma Barcelona, Dept Math, E-08193 Barcelona, Spain.

TI: Rank 2 vector bundles over P-2(C) whose sections vanish on points in general position
DE: Rank 2 vector bundles; General position; Very ampleness
AB: In this paper we address the classification of rank 2 vector bundles E, over P-2(C), such that the zero locus of a general section of E is a set of distinct points in general position. We also discuss the existence of smooth threefolds X = P(E), arising from such bundles.

TI: Invariant symmetries on non-reductive homogeneous pseudo-Riemannian four-manifolds
DE: Killing vector fields; Affine vector fields; Ricci collineations; Matter collineations
ID: MATTER COLLINEATIONS; SPACE-TIMES; RICCI COLLINEATIONS; MANIFOLDS; SOLITONS
AB: We explicitly determine invariant Ricci collineations on four-dimensional non-reductive homogeneous pseudo-Riemannian manifolds, and invariant matter collineations for the Lorentzian examples.

TI: Capacities and Hausdorff measures on metric spaces
DE: Capacity; Generalized Hausdorff measure; Poincare inequality
AB: In this article, we show that in a Q-doubling space , that supports a Q-Poincar, inequality and satisfies a chain condition, sets of Q-capacity zero have generalized Hausdorff h-measure zero for h(t) = log(1-Q-epsilon) (1/t).

AU: Futamura, T; Ohno, T; Shimomura, T
AF: Futamura, Toshihide; Ohno, Takao; Shimomura, Tetsu
TI: Boundary limits of monotone Sobolev functions with variable exponent on uniform domains in a metric space
DE: Monotone Sobolev functions; Nontangential limits; Tangential limits; Lindelof theorem; Variable exponent; Uniform domains
AB: Our aim in this paper is to deal with boundary limits of monotone Sobolev functions with variable exponent on uniform domains in a metric space.

TI: Well posedness and regularity for heat equation with the initial condition in weighted Orlicz-Slobodetskii space subordinated to Orlicz space like lambda(log lambda)(alpha) and the logarithmic weight
DE: Orlicz-Sobolev spaces; Orlicz-Slobodetskii spaces; Heat equation; Evolution problems
ID: BOUNDARY-VALUE PROBLEM; SOBOLEV SPACES; TRACE SPACES; INEQUALITIES; THEOREMS; KERNEL
AB: We consider the initial-value problem u(t) = Delta(x)u(x, t), u(x, 0) = u(x), where and belongs to certain weighted Orlicz-Slobodetskii space subordinated to the logarithmic weight. We prove that under certain assumptions on Orlicz function , the solution belongs to Orlicz-Sobolev space for certain function which in general dominates . The typical representants are , where alpha > 0.

Krbec's work was carried out within the framework of the Institutional Research Plan No. AV0Z10190503 of the Institute of Mathematics, Academy of Sciences of the Czech Republic and was supported by the Grant GACR No. 201/10/1920.

TI: Existence of solutions and regularizing effect for some elliptic nonlinear problems with nonhomogeneous Neumann boundary conditions
DE: p-Laplacian; Entropy solutions; Regularizing effect
AB: We are interested in the regularizing effect of the strongly increasing lower term and also the one due to the summability of the boundary data for nonlinear elliptic problem with nonhomogeneous Neumann boundary conditions of the form {-div a(x, Du) + vertical bar u vertical bar(s-1) u = 0 in Omega a(x, Du) center dot eta = psi on partial derivative Omega.
C1: [Boccardo, L.] Univ Rome, Dipartimento Matemat, Rome, Italy; [Mazon, J. M.] Univ Valencia, Dept Anal Matemat, Valencia, Spain
RP: Mazon, JM (reprint author), Univ Valencia, Dept Anal Matemat, Valencia, Spain.
FX: J.M. Mazon have been partially supported by the Spanish MEC and FEDER, project MTM2012-31103.

TI: Moser-type trace inequalities for generalized Lorentz-Sobolev spaces
DE: Lorentz-Sobolev spaces; Embedding theorems; Sharp constants; Moser-type inequality
ID: DOUBLE EXPONENTIAL INTEGRABILITY; SHARP FORM; TRUDINGER INEQUALITIES; EMBEDDINGS
AB: We give sharp constants concerning exponential and multiple exponential inequalities corresponding to the limiting case of the Sobolev inequalities in generalized Lorentz-Sobolev spaces involving a general class of measures in domains . The results are general enough to include the Moser-type inequalities for smooth submanifolds of , fractal subsets of or trace inequalities on partial derivative Omega.
C1: Charles Univ Prague, Dept Math Anal, Prague 18600 8, Czech Republic
RP: Cerny, R (reprint author), Charles Univ Prague, Dept Math Anal, Sokolovska 83, Prague 18600 8, Czech Republic.
FU: ERC CZ of the Czech Ministry of Education [LL1203]
FX: The author was supported by the ERC CZ grant LL1203 of the Czech Ministry of Education.

TI: A structure property of "vertical" integral currents, with an application to the distributional determinant
DE: Rectifiable currents; Boundary of the graph; Distributional determinant
AB: We deal with integral currents in Cartesian products of Euclidean spaces that satisfy a "verticality" assumption. The main example is the boundary of the graph of some classes vector-valued and non-smooth Sobolev maps, provided that the boundary current has finite mass. In fact, the action of such currents is non-zero only on forms with a high number (depending on the Sobolev regularity) of differentials in the direction of the vertical space. We prove that such vertical currents live on a set that projects on the horizontal space into a nice set with integer dimension. The dimension of the concentration set is related to the level of verticality that is assumed. Therefore, for boundary of graphs of Sobolev maps, this dimension decreases as the Sobolev exponent increases. As an application, we then prove a concentration property concerning the singular part of the distributional determinant and minors.
C1: Univ Parma, Dipartimento Matemat & Informat, I-43124 Parma, Italy
RP: Mucci, D (reprint author), Univ Parma, Dipartimento Matemat & Informat, Parco Area Sci 53-A, I-43124 Parma, Italy.

TI: Semigroup and Poincar, series for a finite set of divisorial valuations
DE: Divisorial valuations; Semigroup of values; Poincare series; Generating sequence
AB: Let be a finite set of divisorial valuations coming from a modification of , where is a field. In this paper we prove that, if is infinite, its semigroup of values is finitely generated whenever there is some finite generating sequence. In that case, we also show that the Poincar, series associated to is a rational function whose denominator can be expressed in terms of the valuation vectors of the elements in the generating sequence. For this we do not need any assumptions on . However, a finite generating sequence does not always exist. We give an example of a modification whose semigroup of values is not finitely generated.
C1: [Van Langenhoven, Leen; Veys, Willem] Katholieke Univ Leuven, Dept Math, B-3001 Leuven, Belgium
RP: Veys, W (reprint author), Katholieke Univ Leuven, Dept Math, Celestijnenlaan 200B, B-3001 Leuven, Belgium.

TI: Linear images of linear groups
DE: Linear group; Linear image of a linear group
AB: Let N be a (Zariski) closed normal subgroup of a linear group G of degree n. It is well known that G/N is always isomorphic to some linear group, but can the degree of this linear group be bounded in terms of n only. The brief answer we give to this is frequently yes, for example if G has characteristic zero or degree at most 2, but not always.
C1: Queen Mary Univ London, London E1 4NS, England
RP: Wehrfritz, BAF (reprint author), Queen Mary Univ London, Mile End Rd, London E1 4NS, England.
